props.synopsis: Gambling among younger Australians is often associated with men making bets online or at the pub with their mates, but research – and the lived experience of young women – shows that is not always the case.

title.children: Ella never thought one bet would cost her thousands, research shows she's not alone

image.altText: Letiticia Fortune walks along a paved footpath wearing a long-sleeve shirt and sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Letiticia Fortune has been ordered to stand trial over an alleged attempt to smother Jonathon Hawtin while he was in a rehabilitation centre, after two others allegedly earlier attempted to take his life in an axe attack.

title.children: Woman accused of smothering attempt on paralysed man pleads not guilty

image.altText: A police blue tent set up a distance away from a white car behind a police line

props.synopsis: A detective has told an inquest of her frustration and regret in the way the death of an Aboriginal woman was investigated in a regional New South Wales town.

title.children: Inquest scrutinises police investigation into Aboriginal mother's death

image.altText: A young woman in a black top and jeans looking at demountable classrooms through a metal fence.

props.synopsis: One of Broken Hill's two high schools was shut down following the discovery of hazardous mould. After more than 12 months, the community is frustrated by the lack of action on the promised rebuild.

title.children: School marked for demolition still standing a year after mould outbreak

image.altText: Georgie Vermeeren stands in front of a grey background with pink roses and green leaves around her face.

props.synopsis: Australian native flowers, dahlias, and chrysanthemum are overtaking the classic rose as more people across the country seek out locally grown blooms.

title.children: Flower trends shift as Australians buy locally grown blooms

image.altText: Josh Carr and Ken Hinkley

props.synopsis: Over the past two decades in the AFL, there have been a handful of coaching succession plans delivering mixed results. Port Adelaide must look to the past to figure out what to do and what not to do with its own handover.

title.children: Port to learn from past successions after gambling on Hinkley and Carr

image.altText: A car caught in a flash flood while a 4WD ploughs through water behind.

props.synopsis: Although February is still peak severe weather season, the majority of extreme events this month are being exacerbated by abnormally warm waters off our coastlines.

title.children: Australia facing heatwaves, drenching and cyclones

image.altText: Ambulances outside a regional hospital.

props.synopsis: A report by the doctors' union says ambulance ramping is now a common occurrence at Mount Gambier Hospital, and patients and staff are being put at risk. But the state government says an expansion is underway.

title.children: Ramping 'common' at regional SA hospital as issue comes to the country

image.altText: Teal PMs Allegra Spender, Monique Ryan, Sophie Scamps, Kylea Tink, Kate Chaney and Zali Steggall at a press conference

props.synopsis: Independent MPs say the Australian people deserve to have the election reforms, which were pushed through by Labor and the Coalition, tested in court. Follow live.

title.children: Teals say election reforms will 'no doubt' face legal challenges

image.altText: A drying dam with only a small amount of water in a brown, rocky landscape

props.synopsis: Rainwater tanks, dams, and springs are running dry in Adelaide Hills and Fleurieu Peninsula while water carriers say they are struggling to meet the demand from both farmers and households.

title.children: Running out of water after record low rainfall in parts of SA

image.altText: A close-up of an Indian man with glasses.

props.synopsis: After a week of increased scrutiny on GFG Alliance, Sanjeev Gupta says his company is "steadily ramping up production" and asks stakeholders to "work together".

title.children: Gupta is 'finalising new financing' to 'catch up' with GFG's creditors

image.altText: A woman standing next to a barber chair.

props.synopsis: Skills shortages, network connectivity issues and added freight costs are just some of the challenges for business owners in regional Australia — but one business group says it's forcing them to be more innovative.

title.children: Insight into what it's like starting a business in a remote town

image.altText: A closeup of a woman with dark hair in a bun looking down, wearing a black coat in front of grey sky.

props.synopsis: Never before has an Australian sportswoman been embroiled in as high profile a scandal as the one Sam Kerr finds herself in now, writes national sport reporter David Mark.

title.children: Sam Kerr's racial harassment trial is a turning point for Australian sport

image.altText: Brielle holds her daughter as she looks off a balcony.

props.synopsis: Apartment living is a key pillar of government plans to ease the housing crisis but some have questioned the viability of the plans, saying the current stock of apartments was poorly suited for families.

title.children: Could a high-rise apartment replace the classic family home?

image.altText: An aboriginal woman with black hair looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Leonie Ebsworth was around 19 years old and enjoying a night at the Empress Hotel in Redfern, New South Wales, when a man approached her and said the impossible.

title.children: 'You're my sister': The words that untangled a stolen childhood

image.altText: Commonwealth Bank chief executive Matt Comyn looks at the camera in an office setting.

props.synopsis: Banks are prohibited from telegraphing rates moves in advance, but it doesn't take much reading between the lines to see that an RBA rate cut next week will be passed on in full.

title.children: CBA boss 'acutely aware' customers expect rate cuts to be passed on

image.altText: A black and white elon  musk stands in front of the X logo

props.synopsis: The number of posts containing slurs doubled and the number of bot accounts also increased, new research by a California team suggests.

title.children: Erase bots or 'die trying': Elon Musk's broken promise for X

image.altText: A researcher holds a pipette under a microscope.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers dependent on US funding are facing an uncertain future as the Trump administration attempts to slash funding and slap restrictions on medical and scientific research.

title.children: Trump funding cuts leave Australian researchers in limbo

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: Wooden hut in thick forest.

props.synopsis: A privately operated walkers' hut, 860 metres of boardwalk and a bridge have been destroyed in fires moving along the Overland Track, as challenging conditions hamper firefighting efforts.

title.children: Overland Track hut, boardwalks destroyed in 'changeable' Tasmanian bushfire

image.altText: A close of a young girl with a shovel of sand

props.synopsis: Cyclone Zelia has intensified to category four and the Bureau of Meteorology says it could be a damaging category five before it crosses the West Australian coast.

title.children: WA cyclone expected to reach category 5 today with 200kph winds

image.altText: A white two-storey house with sprawling garden, green grass.

props.synopsis: Recently ousted Delhi leader Arvind Kejriwal was once touted as "the new moral force in Indian politics". But an estimated $6.2 million upgrade of the chief minister's residence at the taxpayer's expense has taken the shine off his honesty badge.

title.children: Could a $6m reno of his 'Glass Palace' have cost India's anti-corruption champ the Delhi election?

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has opened slightly higher despite a tumble on Wall Street after hotter-than-expected consumer price data. Half-year results drop for insurance giant IAG, Origin Energy. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall St dips over inflation fears, IAG and Origin report strong profits

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ACCC says it will pursue businesses that fail to comply with anti-scam legislation
Average new loan size hits record high
Scam laws need strong codes that punish businesses says Choice

image.altText: Brayden Craig is seen walking in front of a bar in Thailand at night.

props.synopsis: A fraudster who has run scams against Australians for more than two decades has resurfaced at the centre of a dispute over patents potentially worth more than $21 billion.

title.children: 'He disappears, changes his name': Chasing a fraudster

image.altText: Tennis player Elena Rybakina sits next to coach Stefano Vukov, who is talking and gesturing with his hand.

props.synopsis: Elena Rybakina's former coach, Stefano Vukov, says he "never abused anyone" as the women's tennis tour upholds his ban.

title.children: Wimbledon winner 'disappointed' after former coach's ban upheld by WTA

image.altText: A person wearing a shirt with Taylor Swift's face on it walks down the street during pre-Super Bowl celebrations.

props.synopsis: Philadelphia Eagles superstar Saquon Barkley says he does not understand why Taylor Swift was booed at the Super Bowl, adding that she is part of the reason the NFL is growing internationally and taking games to Australia.

title.children: Taylor Swift's Super Bowl boos baffle NFL superstar Saquon Barkley

image.altText: A star with a white stream moving towards the top right hand of the image.

props.synopsis: A special telescope 40 kilometres off the south French coast has detected a slippery particle called a neutrino — and it's unlike anything physicists have seen before.

title.children: Record-breaking 'ghost' particle spotted by underwater telescope

image.altText: A man in tactical gear holds a training assault rifle during a training exercise.

props.synopsis: The move comes in preparation for a possible resumption of fighting in Gaza if Hamas does not release more Israeli hostages on Saturday.

title.children: Israel calls up reservists amid Gaza ceasefire uncertainty

image.altText: Cyberattack illustration

props.synopsis: PNG's version of the ATO has been hit with a massive cyber attack, compromising sensitive data belonging to millions of individuals and private companies, but there's been no word about the breach yet from the Internal Revenue Commission's boss.

title.children: PNG's tax office hit in major cyber attack but public left in the dark about it

image.altText: Boxer Imane Khelif at the Doha Forum. She is sitting in a chair, wearing headphones and holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: Imane Khelif accuses the International Boxing Assocation of spreading "baseless lies and misinformation" after it cited Donald Trump's executive order around transgender athletes in legal action against the IOC.

title.children: Imane Khelif hits out at IBA after it cites Trump order in legal action against IOC

image.altText: A middle aged woman with a slight smile on her face

props.synopsis: The US Senate confirms military veteran Tulsi Gabbard as the Director of National Intelligence, a role involving the oversight of all spy agencies.

title.children: Tulsi Gabbard confirmed as US spy chief

image.altText: Albanese sits at the despatch box in the lower house.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is keeping open the low-probability option of a last-minute dash to the White House ahead of the federal election if the government judges it would sway Donald Trump towards granting Australia a tariff exemption.

title.children: PM keeps door open to unlikely pre-poll Trump trip if tariff crisis worsens

image.altText: Two climbers dressed in black on top of a rock pillar.

props.synopsis: Police say the pair of interstate climbers had to spend the night waiting for rescue after their ropes became "entangled" in high winds.

title.children: 'Particularly complicated': Pair rescued from atop Tasmanian pillar

image.altText: A cricket ball hits the stumps of Steve Smith as he completes a shot in an ODI against Sri Lanka.

props.synopsis: Steve Smith takes another blinding slips catch, but it is only a brief bright spot as a second-string Australia side is dominated by Sri Lanka's captain in the first ODI.

title.children: Another Smith screamer not enough to lift Aussies in Sri Lanka ODI thumping
